subject: CBS Evening News with Katie Couric E-Mail Alert

  The Early Show | CBS Evening News | 48 Hours
    | 60 Minutes | The Saturday Early Show | CBS Sunday
    Morning | Face The
    Nation 















Hi everyone,
 
We'll begin tonight's broadcast with an exclusive
  report on secret efforts to delay Iran's moves to develop nuclear
  technology. Sheila MacVicar will have the story and David Martin will fill in
  more details about our country's volatile relationship with Iran.
 
In Iraq,
  the search for the three U.S.
  soldiers seized two weeks ago continues. Today, the hunt yielded a body that
  Iraqi police believe to be one of the missing soldiers. Mark Strassmann
  reports that the military continues the search while investigators hurry to
  find more clues and identify the body.
 
At home, the summer travel season is rapidly
  approaching, and the Federal Aviation Administration announced a new program that
  is aimed to help better navigate the upcoming stormy summer months. Could it
  work? Nancy Cordes will report.
 
If you're an individual in the United States seeking medical
  insurance coverage, the odds are stacked wildly against you. Our
  investigative team has been probing the sometimes questionable tactics used
  by insurance companies, and tonight Armen Keteyian will have a report.
 
Finally tonight, Sandra Hughes will report that concern
  is growing for the safety of the wayward whale duo dubbed Delta and Dawn,
  which have been circling near a Sacramento River
  bridge. Scientists analyzing photographs of the mother-and-calf pair say
  their appearance indicates declining health. We’ll have more details on
  these whales and what others of their species to get themselves in situations
  like this.
 
I hope you’ll join us.
 




Katie Couric
CouricandCo@cbs.com
